content:
Diagnosis:	Metastatic adenocarcinoma of prostate with widespread skeletal involvement

Treatment:	Palliative radiotherapy to thoracic spine T4-T7 for impending cord compression 2016

Commenced goserelin acetate 10.8mg implant

Flutamide 250mg TDS added September 2023 following biochemical progression

Current PSA 156.8

Demonstrated castration resistance March 2024
Progression despite enzalutamide, initiated prednisolone 10mg daily October 2024

Rising PSA despite steroid switch, commenced dexamethasone 0.5mg bd January 2025

I reviewed [redacted name] in clinic today and discussed his case with [redacted name]. His PSA has unfortunately shown significant progression to 892 (from 584 in December 2024). He reports no lower urinary tract symptoms or bone pain. His appetite remains reasonable though he notes increasing fatigue and general decline in function. He now spends most of the day in his chair or bed.

I have explained that the rising PSA indicates failure of prednisolone to control his disease progression. Given his current performance status of 3, he is not a candidate for systemic chemotherapy. Following discussion with [redacted name], we will adjust his treatment to dexamethasone 0.5mg twice daily. We will arrange follow-up in 12 weeks with repeat PSA measurement.

cancer_timeline.value: Palliative radiotherapy to thoracic spine T4-T7 for impending cord compression
Added flutamide 250mg TDS following biochemical progression

patient_facts.value: increasing fatigue and general decline in function
spends most of the day in chair or bed

status_updates.value: Advanced castration-resistant prostate cancer with widespread bone metastases showing biochemical progression despite multiple lines of hormone therapy, now with poor performance status precluding systemic chemotherapy.
rising PSA indicates failure of prednisolone to control disease progression
adjust treatment to dexamethasone 0.5mg twice daily
follow-up in 12 weeks with repeat PSA measurement
